result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer L. Heilman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order - Temporary Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Violate/Harassment Restraining Order - Temporary Restraining Order
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jennifer L. Heilman

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 4:03 pm 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Def appears in person, pro se. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (Violate Harassment Restraining Order - TRO)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, def is competent to represent self, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
JB makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: $250 plus costs including DNA surcharge (sample already on file) with 60 days to pay or set up payment plan. 
Adj: 4:18 pm

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:43 pm 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Deft appears in person, pro se. 
State notes deft wishes to proceed without any attorney and an offer has just been provided today. 
Deft states wish to accept offer. 
State notes need to investigate another matter before proceeding with a plea. 
COURT leaves dates on the calendar as set at this time and notes plea may be able to be done at Jury Status Hearing. 
COURT provides deft with waiver of atty form to complete. 
Adj: 3:46 pm

Final pre-trial on April 14, 2022 at 03:40 pm.
Jury status hearing on May 20, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Jury Trial on June 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant pro se; called in and is sick
Leave dates on

No contact with victim(s): JWB.   Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:29 pm 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Defendant appears in person, pro se. 
Reading Waived. Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

PLEA: Not Guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: $500 sig bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): JWB. 
- Prints and photograph. 

BRANCH 3 CASE. 
PTC with JA: 3/3/2022 at 2:30 pm. 
FPT: 4/14/2022 at 3:40 pm. 
Jury Status Review: 5/20/2022 at 4:00 pm. 
Jury Trial: 6/23/2022 at 9:00 am.
Re: Copy of Summons and Criminal Complaint mailed to defendant
